content.description:
Match low left crimp rail and move right. Top   out Red Sparrow. 

  Guidebook pgs 6-7: 

docs.google.com/file/d/0BxQ…

  Video: 

youtube.com/watch?v=CfDrkwM…

Sit start on tiny crimps, then find the right body position during balance-y moves towards the top of the slab.

 I was a visiting climber without any guidebook/mountain project (phone was dead) and I got on this. It seems that Sparrow Slab goes up the dihedral to the right of this, so if anybody has any information on this climb (FA, name), let me know. It was a fun little slab climb.
content.location: In between the arete (Red Sparrow) and the dihedral (Sparrow Slab). Sit start on tiny crimps and climb straight up on crimps.

content.description: Sit start at the bottom if the slight dihedral slab, follow the seem hook the slab to the good knobs at the top and mantle.
content.location: Side of Sparrow boulder, to the right of Sparrow Back.

content.description: Sit start the same as Sparrow Slab, but traverse right on sharp crimps and toss for the top lip.
content.location: Starts the same as Sparrow Slab on the side of the Sparrow boulder.

content.description:
Crux is lowest portion you start on. I have been told when you start left hand crimp and right hand sloper this is V3, and when you start at the lowest left hand side pull and right hand on 2-finger pebble this is a V4. Cool climb, regardless. Guidebook has SDS with left hand on lower side pull and right hand on 2-finger pebble as a V5. Input welcome on any of this. 

  Guidebook: docs.google.com/file/d/0BxQ…

  Vid is unofficial/easiest (V3) version: 

youtube.com/watch?v=zRtPO7l…
content.protection: Slight incline on approach but overall nice area for pad.
content.location: If you are at bottom of Parking Lot Boulders, follow creek upstream and Sparrow will be on your right. Usually you will see chalk on this boulder on right side facing West toward parking lot.
